alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; West Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central West Baton Rouge and central East Baton Rouge Parishes through 600 PM CDT... At 514 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Brownfields, or near Baker, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 to 40 mph and brief funnel clouds. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Baker, Port Allen, Merrydale, Brownfields, Greenwell Spring, Westminster, Inniswold, Shenandoah, Old Jefferson and Baton Rouge Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 12 between mile markers 1 and 7. Interstate 110 in Louisiana between mile markers 2 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; West Baton Rouge
